theoryTitle: Usopp's Love Alone Manifested the Klabautermann
theoryText: While the entire crew cared for the Going Merry, it was specifically Usopp's intense love, dedication, and care for the ship that manifested the Klabautermann. As the ship's unofficial caretaker who performed most of the repairs and maintenance, Usopp's emotional connection was uniquely strong enough to bring the ship's spirit to life.
author: Various One Piece fans

theoryTitle: The Klabautermann Was Created by Joy Boy
theoryText: The Klabautermann legend may have been introduced into history through advanced technology or power from the Great Kingdom/Joy Boy. The theory suggests that the Klabautermann was created to protect ships from imminent danger, possibly related to the great flood or other ancient catastrophes. This would connect the maritime folklore to the deeper mysteries of the Void Century.
author: Various theorists on WorstGen and Reddit

theoryTitle: Imu May Be a Klabautermann of the Ancient Kingdom
theoryText: A radical theory suggests that Imu, the mysterious ruler of the World Government, might actually be a Klabautermann - specifically, the ship spirit of the Ancient Kingdom itself, if it was a massive city-ship hybrid. This would explain Imu's longevity, mysterious nature, and deep connection to the world's history. The theory connects the emotional ship spirit concept introduced in Water 7 to the series' endgame mysteries.
author: Reddit user GreatGomp and others

theoryTitle: The Thousand Sunny Will Also Manifest a Klabautermann
theoryText: Given that the Going Merry developed a Klabautermann from being well-loved, fans theorize that the Thousand Sunny will eventually manifest its own ship spirit as the Straw Hats continue to care for and love their new ship. Some speculate this could play a crucial role in the final saga, potentially even allowing communication between the Sunny's spirit and the memory of the Merry's Klabautermann.
author: Various One Piece fans

theoryTitle: The Klabautermann Only Appears to Signal a Ship's Doom
theoryText: According to maritime folklore and Franky's explanation, the Klabautermann making itself visible is actually a bad omen - it only reveals itself to the crew when the ship is doomed and cannot be saved. This theory suggests that Usopp seeing the Klabautermann in Skypiea was the ship's way of saying goodbye and preparing the crew (especially Usopp) for its inevitable end, even as it tried to carry them a little while longer.
author: Based on canon information and fan discussion
